questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage.
Education aims to bring about positive changes in our behavior. It helps us try to change our lives as well as the society we live in. Education that does not illuminate our minds or does not inspire us to work for the community is not complete at all. Education is not all about getting grades or receiving certificates- we use education to make life better. We are expected to apply the knowledge, skills and values that we learn in a classroom in our engagement with the world that lies outside. And we can do so in many different ways. Let's have a look at how education works. Learners' civic engagement is highly appreciated all over the world. Civic engagement means working to make a difference in the civic life (the public life of the citizens as constructed with private or personal life) of the community using knowledge, skills, values and motivation. Civic engagement promotes the quality of life in a community by contributing to the improvement of health and wellbeing of the people.
Civically engaged individuals recognize themselves as members of a larger social community and are concerned about civic issues. They consider themselves responsible citizens who take action or raise their voices against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills.
In civic engagement, issues of public concern are crucial. Civic engagement includes individual or group activities to protect public interests and change the way the community values itself. For example, If you are protesting against any unjust decision of the local municipality such as raising taxes or an act that might work against people's interests, you are civically engaged and your action is considered a civic engagement. This protest can be done in different ways such as organizing rallies, collecting signatures, making human chains, writing petitions, etc. You can also help control traffic in front of a school, help children to cross the roads, work in a team to clean a park or a sea beach. You can also give some services to elderly people. These are all examples of civic engagement as what you do directly affects the community.
When civic engagement is a part of an academic program, and the learners' engagement is assessed following a scale, then it is called service learning. It involves the application of knowledge and skills learned in the classroom and then making a complete plan of action 1.e. preparing a budget, starting the process of implementation, involving people and activating operational strategies.

sub_questions.explanation: Education plays a vital role in bringing about positive changes in behaviour. It helps us try to change our life as well as our society. Complete education not only illuminates our minds but also inspires us to work for the community. The purpose of education is not getting grades and receiving certificates. The main objective of education is to make life better. Civic engagement of the learners is highly appreciated all over the world nowadays. A civically engaged person works to create a difference in the civic life taking action or raising voice against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills. When we work for social welfare, we are civically engaged. Civic engagement may be individual or group activities. For example, we can raise voice against raising excessive taxes. This protest can be done by organising ralles, collecting signature, making human chains, etc. Learners engagement is evaluated by following a scale. Rnowledge and skills learned in the school is applied. in society for public welfare.

questions.uddipok:
Summarize the following text:
Once in water, you get oblivious of time, distance or direction. The only thought which kept me worried, was that I must make it and that I must get good weather all the way. The second half of the swim is always very difficult. And if even little waves develop, it saps the ebbing energy of the swimmer all the more. Taking a lesson from my previous swims I kept my speed at a steady pace for I knew I would need every ounce of my energy towards the close. I felt hungry and famished and shouted for my manager. In reply, I was told that I could not afford to waste 10 minutes in having the feed! If I have to break the record, I must swim on with all my might. But I refused. I am sorry now for it. For if I had gone on. I might have finished the whole swim in less than 10 hours and 15 minutes creating a new world record from both sides…………

sub_questions.explanation: The swimmer describes the mental state during a long-distance swim. They lose track of time and focus solely on completing the race and maintaining good weather. The second half is the hardest, and even small waves deplete energy. The swimmer remembers needing to conserve energy for the end and ate only after refusing initially. They now regret this decision, believing it might have secured them a new world record under 10 hours and 15 minutes.

sub_questions.explanation: The bar graph illustrates the steady increase in the number of internet users in Bangladesh from 2014 to 2019. questions.uddipok:
Complete the following story in your own words.
An ant lived on the bank of a river. The level of water in the river was increasing gradually. One day, a wave stroke at the shore. At that moment, the ant was walking. It slipped into water and......

sub_questions.explanation:
Title: The Ant and the Dove
An ant lived on the bank of a river. The level of water in the river was increasing gradually. One day, a wave struck the shore. At that moment, the ant was walking. It slipped into the water and began to struggle desperately. The current was strong, and the poor ant was about to drown.
Just then, a dove sitting on a nearby tree saw the ant in danger. Moved by compassion, the dove quickly plucked a leaf from the tree and dropped it into the river near the ant. The ant climbed onto the leaf and floated safely to the shore. It looked up at the dove with gratitude and silently promised to return the kindness someday.
A few days later, a hunter came to the riverbank with a net. He aimed his weapon at the same dove resting peacefully on a branch. The ant noticed it and knew it had to act fast. It crawled to the hunter’s foot and bit him sharply. Startled, the hunter missed his aim, and the dove flew away to safety.
Thus, the ant repaid the dove’s kindness. Both went on with their lives, grateful for each other.
Moral: A good deed is never forgotten.

questions.uddipok:
Suppose, you are Alif/Adrita. You have just received a letter from your pen-friend Clara who lives at 17 Dawning
Street, U.K. She wants to know about Bangladesh. Now, write a reply to the letter.

sub_questions.explanation:
Dear Clara,
I hope this letter finds you well. It was delightful to hear from you! Thank you for your interest in Bangladesh; I'd be happy to share more about my country with you.
Bangladesh is a beautiful country located in South Asia, bordered by India to the west, north, and east, with Myanmar (Burma) lying to the southeast. One of the most fascinating aspects of Bangladesh is its rich cultural heritage. We have a diverse population comprising various ethnic groups, religions, and languages, which contribute to our vibrant tapestry of traditions and customs.
The natural beauty of Bangladesh is truly breathtaking. We are blessed with lush green landscapes, picturesque rivers, and the world's largest river delta, the Sundarbans, home to the majestic Royal Bengal Tiger. Our cuisine is also something to behold, with mouthwatering dishes like biryani, hilsa fish curry, and pitha (traditional sweets) tantalizing taste buds across the nation.
However, like any country, Bangladesh faces its share of challenges. We grapple with issues such as poverty, overpopulation, and environmental degradation. Yet, amidst these challenges, the resilience and spirit of the Bangladeshi people shine through.
I would love to hear more about life in the U.K. and your experiences living there. Please feel free to ask me anything else you'd like to know about Bangladesh; I'm always eager to share more about my homeland.
Looking forward to your next letter!
Warm regards,
Alif/Adrita
